page.title: 13Education in Kinver
page.content: Local children start school at Foley Infants which is at the foot of Kinver Edge. At age 8 they go to Brindley Heath Junior School. Both these schools are in new buildings. Part of Edgecliff Comprehensive School was built in the 1960s but the Old Block was built before the war. It has open corridors and is very cold and draughty in winter. However all the schools have excellent facilities. Brindley and Edgecliff share the same site with extensive playing fields. Pupils come to Edgecliff not just from Kinver but from villages several miles to the north outside this block. There are about 700 pupils in the school including 80 in the Sixth Form.
